intro: Eriogonum gracilipes, commonly known as the slender leaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pale green to reddish stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Eriogonum gracilipes is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in poor, well-drained conditions.
